intro: Angelica pancicii, commonly known as the Balkan angelica, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Angelica pancicii is also valued for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
